<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 166</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:809" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 809</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ... seu tabe vetustas Abstulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum tabe mensum mortuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <trans><tr>barrenness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 21, 33, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vis morbi, uti tabes, plerosque civium animos invaserat,</quote> <trans><tr>like a consuming fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta vis avaritiae, velut tabes, invaserat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 32, 4</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 22, 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabes crescentis fenoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecit ea tabes legionum quoque motas jam mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:807" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 807</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos durus amor crudeli tabe peredit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 442</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47331.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">the moisture of a melting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">decaying substance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi> (rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tabes liquentis nivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funesta veneni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinctaque mortiferā tabe sagitta madet,</quote> <trans><tr>poison</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pituitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putri arboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 19, 21, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aceti asperitas visque in tabem margaritas resolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabesco: <entryFree id="n47332" type="main" key="ta_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n47332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [tabes], <hi rend="ital">to melt gradually</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be dissolved</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consumed; to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pine</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dwindle away; to decay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languish</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47332.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoribus durescit umor: et idem vicissim mollitur tepefactus et tabescit calore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 516</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nives radiis (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 964</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:581" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 581</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sal,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 88, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 8, 44, § 95</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">calore Corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 363</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47332.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescere itemque dies licet et tabescere noctes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 680</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">senex dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 680</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo maerore maceror, Macesco, consenesco et tabesco miser, Ossa atque pellis sum miser macritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:Capt. 1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeterno luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderio alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolore ac miseriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduis curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:1:77" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel (Hypsipyle) Aemonio tabuit hospitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:15:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 15, 20</bibl></cit> (18): <cit><quote lang="la">amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 445</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 259</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodque aliena capella gerat distentius uber, Tabescat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is consumed with envy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quibus (litteris) perspicio, nobis in hac calamitate tabescendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 25 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tabidosus: <entryFree id="n47333" type="main" key="ta_bi^do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabidus</etym>, <sense id="n47333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">corrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decaying</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pudic. 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> (al. tabiosus).</sense></entryFree>
tabidulus: <entryFree id="n47334" type="hapax" key="ta_bi^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 182</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabidus: <entryFree id="n47335" type="main" key="ta_bi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabeo</etym>, <sense id="n47335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wasting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decaying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrefying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pining away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languishing</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n47335.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corruptum et tabidum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 147" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 358" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:1:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabidus erro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>pining for love</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:3:50" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 3, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47335.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corrupting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infectious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:79:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 79, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>starvation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 691" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 691</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
tabificabilis: <entryFree id="n47336" type="hapax" key="ta_bi^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabificus</etym>, <sense id="n47336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>: letum liberorum, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 27</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 421 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tabificatio: <entryFree id="n47337" type="main" key="ta_bi^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tabifico</etym>, <sense id="n47337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">decay</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 122:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 122, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabifico: <entryFree id="n47338" type="main" key="ta_bi^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tabes-facio</etym>, <sense id="n47338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consume</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 37, 5</bibl>; Aug. c. Jul. 5, 15, 54.</sense></entryFree>
tabificus: <entryFree id="n47339" type="main" key="ta_bi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infectious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corroding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radii (solis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum lentum atque tabificum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 73</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">seps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 723</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:911" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 911</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:276" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 276</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli vitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 79" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oedip. 79</bibl></cit>: terram edisse his tabificum<cb n="TABU" />  est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 29</bibl>: tabificae mentis perturbationes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabifluus: <entryFree id="n47340" type="main" key="ta_bi^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabes-fluo</etym> (late Lat.). * <sense id="n47340.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wasting away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decaying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 958</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47340.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuming</hi>: morbus, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:430" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 430</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabiosus: <entryFree id="n47341" type="main" key="ta_bi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. tabidosus.</entryFree>
tabis: <entryFree id="n47342" type="main" key="Tabis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tabis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain of Eastern Asia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 17, 29, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabitudo: <entryFree id="n47343" type="hapax" key="ta_bi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tabidus</etym>, <sense id="n47343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consumption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decline</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo ad tabitudinem redactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 61, § 129</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 28, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tablinum: <entryFree id="n47344" type="main" key="tabli_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tablīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. tabulinum.</entryFree>
tablisso: <entryFree id="n47344.1" type="gloss" key="tablisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tablisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">tabli/zw,</foreign> <sense id="n47344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play dice</hi>, acc. to Diom. pp. 417 and 421 P.</sense></entryFree>
tabraca: <entryFree id="n47345" type="main" key="Ta_bra^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tābrăca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thābrăca</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Mediterranean Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tabarkah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 3, 2, § 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:194" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 194</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:256" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 256</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabula: <entryFree id="n47346" type="main" key="ta^bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>root ta-, tab; whence also taberna, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n47346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plank.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47346.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si tabulam de naufragio stultus arripuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 23, 89</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laceras tabulas in litore vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:289" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 537</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inauratae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latera (fossarum) cluduntur tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforatae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a board to play on</hi>, Ov. de Nuce, 77; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 14:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:90" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47346.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47346.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A writing-tablet;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a tablet written upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, as a letter, contract, account, list, will, etc. (cf. tabella): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae litteris Graecis confectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: litteraria, <hi rend="ital">a writing-tablet</hi> for children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">laevo suspensi loculos tabulamque lacerto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponatur calculus assint Cum tabula pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:41" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 41</bibl></cit>: tabula calculatoria, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47346.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a book of account</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tabulis, Ubi aera perscribuntur usuraria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multum differt, in arcāne positum sit argentum, an in tabulis debeatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:3:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae lituraeque omnes assimulatae, expressae, de tabulis in libros transferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:77:section=189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 77, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in tabulas referre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:23:section=60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 23, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unae tabulae proferantur, in quibus vestigium sit aliquod, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 5, 12</bibl></cit> (1, 2): novae, <hi rend="ital">new account-books</hi> (by substituting which for the old ones debts were abolished in whole or in part), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 23, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 21, 2</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47346.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A counter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi> where records are kept: <cit><quote lang="la">suos necessarios conrogat, ut ad tabulam Sextiam sibi adsint horā secundā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47346.6" n="D" level="2"> Adest ad tabulam: licetur Aebutius (a tablet on which an auction was advertised); <cit><quote lang="la">hence,</quote> <trans><tr>an auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sin ad tabulam venimus, vincemus facultates Othonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 40, 4</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47346.7" n="E" level="2"> Of public records, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula praerogativae,</quote> <trans><tr>a list of votes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:17:1" default="NO">3, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui de tabulis publicis recitat,</quote> <trans><tr>public records</tr>, <tr>State papers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36, 11</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the censor</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s lists</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabularum cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4</bibl></cit>. 8, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria publica recensionis tabulis publicis impressa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 27, 74</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae aereae, in quibus publicae constitutiones inciduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 21, § 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">XII. tabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Twelve Tables</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">the tables of the laws</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem tabulas conscripsisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duabus tabulis additis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 195 al.</bibl>; v. duodecim; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nequa tabula ullius decreti Caesaris aut beneficii figeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula Sullae,</quote> <trans><tr>the list of proscribed persons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:69:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47346.8" n="F" level="1"> Of any formal or solemn writing: <cit><quote lang="la">in tabulas multis haec via fecit iter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a will</tr>, <tr>testament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 332</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:19" default="NO">4, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:123" default="NO">12, 123</bibl>; 14, 55; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:39:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 39, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dicaearchi tabulae,</quote> <trans><tr>maps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapideae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:24:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 24, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 3, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47346.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A painted tablet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">panel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a painting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabula picta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago in tabulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 161</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 5, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:41" default="NO">2, 3, 41</bibl>; <cb n="TABU" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 64</bibl>. — Prov.: manum de tabulā, <hi rend="ital">take your hand from the picture! enough! it is finished!</hi> sed heus tu, manum de tabulā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 25, 1</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit (Apelles) ... uno se praestare, quod manum de tabulā sciret tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47346.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A votive-tablet</hi> (on which a shipwreck was painted): <cit><quote lang="la">me tabula sacer Votiva paries indicat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largire inopi, ne pictus oberret Caeruleā in tabulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:32" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 32</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mersā rate naufragus assem Dum rogat et pictā se tempestate tuetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:301" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 301</bibl></cit>). — </sense><sense id="n47346.11" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plot</hi> of ground in a vineyard, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 9</bibl>; Auct. Limit. p. 311 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n47346.12" n="L" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fold</hi> in a garment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 1</bibl> and 5.</sense></entryFree>
tabulamentum: <entryFree id="n47347" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tabula</etym>, <sense id="n47347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boarding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flooring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 587, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabularia: <entryFree id="n47348" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. tabularius, II.</entryFree>
tabularis: <entryFree id="n47349" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabula</etym>, <sense id="n47349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to boards</hi> of wood or <hi rend="ital">plates</hi> of metal. </sense><sense id="n47349.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aeris temperatura statuaria eademque tabularia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 75</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47349.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n47349.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">plates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 19, 1</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47349.4" n="B" level="2"> Tabulare palati, <hi rend="ital">the roof of the mouth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tabularium: <entryFree id="n47350" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. tabularius, III.</entryFree>
tabularius: <entryFree id="n47351" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ri^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tabula, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n47351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to written documents;</hi> used only <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47351.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a keeper of archives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a registrar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a public notary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scrivener</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:4:18" default="NO">50, 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:13:1" default="NO">50, 13, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; 43, 5, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2348</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2962</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3246</bibl> sq. al.— </sense><sense id="n47351.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47351.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A place where records were kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a record-office</hi> (for the more usual tabularium), Claud. Aug. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 208, 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47351.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The office of a registrar</hi> or <hi rend="ital">public notary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 9, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47351.5" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">archives</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:502" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 502</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:810" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 810</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:90" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3207 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n47352" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ri^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. 1. tabularius, I.</entryFree>
tabulatim: <entryFree id="n47353" type="hapax" key="ta^bu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tabula, II. K.</etym>, <sense id="n47353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in rows</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disponere genera vitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tabulatio: <entryFree id="n47354" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tabula</etym>, <sense id="n47354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a planking</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flooring over; a floor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">story</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tela tabulationem perfringerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures theatrorum ligneorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tabulatum: <entryFree id="n47355" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. tabulatus.</entryFree>
tabulatus: <entryFree id="n47356" type="main" key="ta^bu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>tabula</etym>, <sense id="n47356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">boarded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">floored.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47356.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: gentes quae tabulatis habitant aedificiis, Fest. s. v. adtubernalis, p. 12 Müll.— More freq., </sense><sense id="n47356.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n47356.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">board-work</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a flooring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">floor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">story</hi> (cf. contignatio): <cit><quote lang="la">turris tabulatorum quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 464</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 672</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa tabulata conceperant, ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:26" default="NO">8, 10, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: fiunt tabulata falaeque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 7</bibl> (Ann. v. 389 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">si in terrā et tabulato olea nimium diu erit, putescet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on the floor</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 55</bibl>; 3, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:9" default="NO">1, 6, 9</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47356.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of branches of trees, grapes, etc., <hi rend="ital">a layer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">row</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:44:3" default="NO">12, 44, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:11" default="NO">5, 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 361</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes">12, 1, 5, § 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabulinum: <entryFree id="n47357" type="main" key="ta^bu^li_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăbŭlīnum</orth> (also contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăblīnum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n47357.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A balcony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrace</hi>, or other floored place in the open air: (cenitabant) rure in corte, in urbe in tabulino, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 83, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47357.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place where family records were kept</hi>, <hi rend="ital">archives</hi> (for the usual tabularium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 178 sq. — </sense><sense id="n47357.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A picture-gallery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 364, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tabum: <entryFree id="n47358" type="main" key="ta_bum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tābum</orth>, <itype>i, o, um</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n47358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabum fluentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 520" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 520</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 19</bibl> P.) [tabes]. </sense><sense id="n47358.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">corrupt moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corruption</hi>, <hi rend="ital">putrid gore</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): saxa spargens tabo, sanie et sanguine atro, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl> (Trag. v. 414 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 626</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 487</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:760" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 760</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 646</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 70</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> tabi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 547</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47358.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, like sanies, of <hi rend="ital">the liquor of the purple-fish</hi>, <pb n="1833" /> <cb n="TACE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:125" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 125</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47358.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, abstr., <hi rend="ital">an infectious disease</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plague</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pestilence</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">turpi dilapsa cadavera tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 557</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora affecta tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pallidaque exsangui squalebant corpora tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infecit pabula tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 481</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taburnus: <entryFree id="n47359" type="main" key="Ta^burnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăburnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mountainchain south of Caudium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Samnium and Campania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in olives</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Monte Taburno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 509</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taceo: <entryFree id="n47360" type="main" key="ta^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĕo</orth>, <itype>cŭi, cĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n47360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [etym. dub.; perh. root tak-, tvak-, to be or make quiet, content; Sanscr. tucyati, to satisfy; v. Fick, Vergl. Wört. s. v. § 73; 362]. </sense><sense id="n47360.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be silent</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">not to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to say nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s peace</hi> (therefore more limited in signif. than silere, to be still, to make no noise): qui dicta loquive tacereve possit, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 255 Vahl.); so, tacere ac fabulari, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 475, 2</bibl> (Trag. v. 182 ib.): <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Ne obturba ac tace. <hi rend="ital">Mil.</hi> Taceo. <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Si tacuisses, jam istuc taceo non natum foret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:49 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 49 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silete et tacete,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> prol. 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taceamne an praedicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 3, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea lingulaca est nobis, nam numquam tacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad loquendum atque ad tacendum tute habeas portisculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacendo loqui videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Abdera, non tacente me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis tacentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an me taciturum tantis de rebus existimavistis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taceamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacere nondum volumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taceri si vis, vera dicito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut doceam Rullum posthac in iis saltem tacere rebus, in quibus de se et de suis factis taceri velit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47360.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for silere, of animals and things, concr. and abstr., <hi rend="ital">to be still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at rest</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">canis ipse tacet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vere prius volucres taceant, aestate cicadae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox erat ... Cum tacet omnis ager pecudes pictaeque volucres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 525</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec diu taceat procax locutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 61, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non oculi tacuere tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: plectra dolore tacent; <cit><quote lang="la">muta dolore lyra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacet stridor litui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 575" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">essedo tacente,</quote> <trans><tr>noiseless</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister tacens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>standing still</tr>, <tr>frozen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:84:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solitudo et tacentes loci,</quote> <trans><tr>hushed</tr>, <tr>still</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca tacentia,</quote> <trans><tr>the under world</tr>, <tr>the silent land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae tacentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 49: <cit><quote lang="la">tacere indolem illam Romanam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>did not show itself</tr>, <tr>had disappeared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blanditiae taceant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 66</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47360.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pass over in silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be silent respecting</hi> a thing (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et tu hoc taceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vera audivi, taceo et contineo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiabo ... quod adhuc semper tacui et tacendum putavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid dixit aut quid tacuit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:49" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissa tacere Qui nequit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alios taceam,</quote> <trans><tr>not to speak of others</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 177</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Narcissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 558" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 558</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tacebimus, quid in ipso homine prosit homini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignotumst, tacitumst, creditumst,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureus in medio Marte tacetur Amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir Celtiberis non tacende gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 1</bibl></cit>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcenda</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things not to be uttered</hi>: dicenda tacenda locutus, <foreign lang="greek">r(hta\ kai\ a)/rrhta,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">things fit and unfit to be spoken</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 72</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis est culpa tacenda loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 604</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tă-cĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n47360.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that is passed over in silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not spoken of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kept secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unmentioned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima duo capita epistulae tuae tacita mihi quodammodo relinquenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tacitum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 64</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum ab antiquis tacitum praetermissumque sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:841" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 841</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitum erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspendas potins me, quam tacita tu haec auferas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without my speaking of it</tr>, <tr>uncontradicted by me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera si reprehenderis, non feres tacitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne id quidem ab Turno tulisse tacitum ferunt: dixisse enim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 9</bibl></cit>; so, too, tacitum ferre. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 45, 6</bibl>: non patientibus tacitum<cb n="TACI" />  tribunis, quod, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacere nequeo misera, quod tacito usus est,</quote> <trans><tr>silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47360.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47360.6" n="a" level="4"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">that is done without words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assumed as a matter of course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tacit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia scriptis, sed quaedam, quae perspicua sint, tacitis exceptionibus caveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:47:140" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 47, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conventio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:2:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:68" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:66" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">substitutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:25" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 28, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indutiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:46" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fideicommissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47360.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">That is done</hi> or <hi rend="ital">exists in silence; silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secret</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hidden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus decrevit, ut tacitum judicium ante comitia fierit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit> Bait.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures ipsae tacito eum (modum) sensu sine arte definiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:60:203" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 60, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes enim tacito quodam sensu sine ullā arte aut ratione quae sint ... recta ac prava dijudicant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob tacitas cum Marcello offensiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitum vivit sub pectore vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 67</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:743" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:623" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 623</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulare sperasti, tacitusque meā decedere terrā,</quote> <trans><tr>secretly</tr>, <tr>unobserved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 306</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a secret</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciti vulgator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 51</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47360.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that does not speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not uttering a sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiseless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod boni est, id tacitus taceas tute tecum et gaudeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitus tace modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrumans tacitus auscultabat, quae ego loquebar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid exspectas auctoritatem loquentium, quorum voluntatem tacitorum perspicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos me jam hoc tacito intellegetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:73:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 73, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (patria) tecum tacita loquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: voluntas; <cit><quote lang="la">quae si tacitis nobis intellegi posset, verbis omnino non uteremur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 18, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:16:section=41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 16, § 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil me mutum delectare potest, nihil tacitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quam conjecturam adfert hominibus tacita corporis figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacita vestra exspectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:23:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 23, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensiones nec tacitae nec occultae,</quote> <trans><tr>implied</tr>, <tr>tacit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mori tacitum oportet, taceamus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without making a defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contumeliam tacitus tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut forte legentem Aut tacitum impellat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>meditating</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro sollicitis non tacitus reis,</quote> <trans><tr>eloquent</tr>, <tr>outspoken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitus pasci si posset corvus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacitā fistula cum lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 19, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum pererrat Luminibus tacitis,</quote> <trans><tr>with silent glances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>without thunder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 533</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">per tacitum nemus ire,</quote> <trans><tr>still</tr>, <tr>silent</tr>, <tr>quiet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 386</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:32:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:62:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 62, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">limen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:552" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 552</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem surgens sedatis amnibus altus Per tacitum Ganges,</quote> <trans><tr>in its silent course</tr>, <tr>flowing silently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">trahitur Gangesque Padusque Per tacitum mundi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>through subterranean passages</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus per tacitum allapsus,</quote> <trans><tr>silently</tr>, <tr>in silence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:354" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 354</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erumpunt sub casside fusae Per tacitum lacrimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:554" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 554</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:216" default="NO">17, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47360.9" n="C" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">proper name</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tă-cĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Muta, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Silence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecce anus in mediis residens annosa puellis Sacra facit Tacitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:572" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 572</bibl></cit>; v. also 2. Tacitus.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">silently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">auscultemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite rogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tacite dat ipsa lex potestatem defendendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perire tacite obscureque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tulit verecundiam senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecrari praetereuntem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 58, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus labens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tacita: <entryFree id="n47361" type="main" key="Ta^ci^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăcĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. taceo, C.</entryFree>
tacite: <entryFree id="n47362" type="main" key="ta^ci^te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 1. taceo, <sense id="n47362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tacito: <entryFree id="n47363" type="main" key="ta^ci^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtō</orth> = <itype>tacite</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> (very rare): <sense id="n47363.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Elissa fugam tacito molitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tacitulus: <entryFree id="n47364" type="main" key="ta^ci^tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. tacitus], <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without speaking</hi> (only in the two foll. passages), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 47, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">550, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taciturio: <entryFree id="n47365" type="hapax" key="ta^ci^tu_ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtūrĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n47365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. desid. n.</hi> [taceo], <hi rend="ital">to desire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">try to keep silence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturire jam deliberavimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taciturnitas: <entryFree id="n47366" type="main" key="ta^ci^turni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭturnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>taciturnus</etym>, <sense id="n47366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeping silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taciturnity</hi> <cb n="TADI" /> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitatem alicujus experiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:65:231" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 65, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curiae taciturnitas annua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis exspectas contumeliam, cum sis gravissimo judicio taciturnitatis oppressus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas testium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas imitatur confessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:32:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 32, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitionem mihi majorem tua taciturnitas attulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taciturnitas pudorque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid foret Iliae Mavortisque puer, si taciturnitas Obstaret meritis invida Romuli,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>silence on the part of poets</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 23</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est Fide et taciturnitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosti hominis tarditatem et taciturnitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 1" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">desideravit Maecenatis taciturnitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 66</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed paucorum taciturnitatibus tradidisse sacrorum ritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 168</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taciturnus: <entryFree id="n47367" type="main" key="ta^ci^turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭturnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. tacitus</etym>, <sense id="n47367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">not talkative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of few words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taciturn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noiseless</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, but cf. taciturnitas): quia tristem semper, quia taciturnum videbant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:583" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 583</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obstinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserta loca et taciturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 24</bibl></cit>: tineas pasces (liber) taciturnus inertes, <hi rend="ital">silent</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">unread</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liris taciturnus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 31, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:426" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 426</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ingenium) statuā taciturnius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.: Pa.</hi> Valetne ostium? <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Bellissimum hercle vidi et taciturnissimum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 20</bibl>.— No <pos>adv.</pos></sense></entryFree>
tacitus: <entryFree id="n47368" type="main" key="ta^ci^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of taceo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47369" type="main" key="Ta^ci^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. <itype>taceo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, C.</etym>, <sense id="n47369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n47369.1" n="I" level="1"> Cornelius Tacitus, <hi rend="ital">the greatest Roman historian of the imperial epoch</hi>, born between A. D. 50 and A. D. 60; <cit><quote lang="la">flourished under Trajan, and was a friend of the younger Pliny,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47369.2" n="II" level="1"> M. Claudius Tacitus, <hi rend="ital">Roman emperor</hi> A. D. 275, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 36" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tacompsos: <entryFree id="n47370" type="main" key="Tacompsos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tacompsos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Ethiopia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon an island of the Nile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35</bibl>, §§ 178 and 180.</sense></entryFree>
tactilis: <entryFree id="n47371" type="main" key="tacti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tactĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n47371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be touched</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tangible</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
