tactio: <entryFree id="n47372" type="main" key="tacti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n47372.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi> (Plautin.), as a verbal noun with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi hanc digito tactio est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 27</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47372.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sense of touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum et tactionum et odorationum et saporum (voluptates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tactor: <entryFree id="n47373" type="main" key="tactor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a toucher</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 95:6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 95, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tactus: <entryFree id="n47374" type="main" key="tactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tango.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47375" type="main" key="tactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tactus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n47375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a touching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handling</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47375.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutantum tactu praeterque meantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (chordae) ad quemque tactum respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo asper tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 683</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 618</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 416</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 502</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus Assilientis aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactuque viriles Virgineo removete manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:466" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 466</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">viriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:434" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 434</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">membra reformidant mollem quoque saucia tactum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47375.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47375.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Influence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">operation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:46:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 46, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentio illorum tactu orationem meam quasi colorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47375.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The sense of feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus corporis est sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:434 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 434 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus toto corpore aequabiliter fusus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut caelum sub aspectum et tactum cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere tactum atque gustatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 4, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyrenaei (dicunt) ea se sola percipere, quae tactu intimo sentiant, ut dolorem, ut voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 76</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ... non odore ullo, non tactu, non sapore capiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 17, 42</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 454</bibl> is an interpolation; v. Lachm. and Munro ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
tader: <entryFree id="n47376" type="main" key="Tader"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tader</orth>, <itype>eris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3, 4, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tadiates: <entryFree id="n47377" type="main" key="Tadi^a_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tadĭātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extinct tribe of Central Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tadinates: <entryFree id="n47378" type="main" key="Tadina_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tadinātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Umbria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl> § 114. <pb n="1834" /> <cb n="TAED" /></sense></entryFree>
tadius: <entryFree id="n47379" type="main" key="Tadius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tadius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a painter of the Age of Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tadu: <entryFree id="n47380" type="main" key="Tadu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tadu</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Meroë in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 33, § 185</bibl> Jan. (al. Tado).</sense></entryFree>
taeda: <entryFree id="n47381" type="main" key="taeda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taeda</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tēda</orth>), <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n47381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> taedaï, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:897" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 897</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. taedet</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a resinous species of pine-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the pitch-pine tree</hi> (syn. fax): Pinus combra, Linn. </sense><sense id="n47381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 19, § 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 11, 21, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:43" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 11, § 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">35, 6, 25, § 41: ceu flamma per taedas equitavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 43</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47381.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Resinous fir</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pine wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitch-pine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupas taedā ac pice refertas incendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyrā erectā taedis atque ilice sectā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">schedias taedā comburere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47381.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pitchpine torch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a torch</hi>: circumstant cum ardentibus taedis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 89</bibl> (Trag. v. 51 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae ardentes Furiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres dicitur inflammasse taedas eis ignibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:494" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 494</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensis currere taedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedas Hymenaeus Amorque Praecutiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 758</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">a nuptial torch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 18 al.</bibl>; hence, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a wedding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marriage</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 339</bibl>; 7, 388; 9, 76; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 721</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 768</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 326</bibl>; 14, 677; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 826: copulari taedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 493" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jungere taedas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:53" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teque mihi taeda pudica dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacra conubia fallere taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:2:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; and for <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:8:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 8, 21</bibl>: taedaeque ad funera versae, <hi rend="ital">torches reversed</hi>, in sign of mourning, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:184" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:547" default="NO">13, 547</bibl>.—As an instrument of torture: <cit><quote lang="la">verbera, carnifices, robur, pix, lamina, taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1017" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1017</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:155" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 155</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47381.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pine board</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sawn plank</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolato confisus ligno, digitis a morte remotus Quattuor, aut septem, si sit latissima taeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:59" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 59</bibl></cit>. — * </sense><sense id="n47381.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A small piece of pork</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fat</hi>, used for religious purposes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taedeo: <entryFree id="n47382" type="main" key="taedeo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedeo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, v. taedet, II.</entryFree>
taedescit: <entryFree id="n47383" type="hapax" key="taedescit"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedescit</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers. inch.</hi> [taedet], <hi rend="ital">it disgusts</hi>: quos prius taedescit impudicitiae suae quam pudescit, <hi rend="ital">who are disgusted</hi>, Min. Oct. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
taedet: <entryFree id="n47384" type="main" key="taedet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedet</orth>, <itype>dŭit or sum est, 2</itype>, <sense id="n47384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> [perh. root tau-; Sanscr. tu-, to be strong; tiv-, to grow fat; cf. tumeo]. </sense><sense id="n47384.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">It disgusts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wearies</hi> one; <hi rend="ital">I</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thou</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">am disgusted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tired</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weary of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I loathe</hi>, etc.; with <case>acc.</case> of the person and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of the thing; or with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (cf. piget): <cit><quote lang="la">sunt homines, quos libidinis infamiaeque suae neque pudeat neque taedeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos talium civium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 42, 105</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me ibi male convivii sermonisque Taesum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedet ipsum Pompeium vehementerque paenitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:22:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 4</bibl>: abeo intro; <cit><quote lang="la">taedet sermonis tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cottidianarum harum formarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 71</bibl></cit>: mentionis, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedet jam audire eadem miliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedet caeli convexa tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 451</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 617</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 888</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taeduit incohasse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47384.2" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., sometimes as a personal verb, <hi rend="ital">to be disgusted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be weary of</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">coepi taedere captivitatis, Hier. Vit. Malch. n. 7: exterrita est quae parit et taeduit animam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 14, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taedifer: <entryFree id="n47385" type="hapax" key="taedi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taedafero</etym>, <sense id="n47385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">torch-bearing</hi>: dea, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ceres</hi>, who kindled a pine-torch on Mount Ætna, in order to search for Proserpine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taedio: <entryFree id="n47386" type="main" key="taedi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>taedium</etym>, <sense id="n47386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feel loathing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be weary</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">neque umquam taediavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor taedians,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal taedians,</quote> <trans><tr>loathing its food</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taediose: <entryFree id="n47387" type="main" key="taedi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>taediosus</etym>, <sense id="n47387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tediously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irksomely</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 51, 4</bibl>; cf. Gram. ap. Mai. Auct. Class. 8, p. 3.</sense></entryFree>
taediosus: <entryFree id="n47388" type="main" key="taedi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taedium</etym>, <sense id="n47388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearisome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irksome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tedious</hi>: sarcina lucis, Firm. Math. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
taedium: <entryFree id="n47389" type="main" key="taedi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>taedet</etym>, <sense id="n47389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weariness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irksomeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tediousness; loathing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgust</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period; perh. not at all in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n47389.1" n="I" level="1"> Subject. </sense><sense id="n47389.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum adversarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 62, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: confectus taedio puellae, Auct. B. Alex. 23: taedio curarum fessus, <cb n="TAET" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium movere sui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO">12, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere taedium vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">educationis taedium suscipere libenter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 332</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longi belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coepti mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:615" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:718" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 718</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47389.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum oppugnatio obsidentibus prius saepe quam obsessis taedium afferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 34, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">evitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum virtutes etiam ipsae taedium pariant, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supervacua cum taedio dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse taedio alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitum taedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne te capiant taedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 21, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedio aliquem afficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedia subeunt animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:34" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47389.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., <hi rend="ital">loathsomeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a disgusting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">irksome thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a nuisance</hi> (Plinian): vetustas oleo taedium affert, <hi rend="ital">a loathsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rancid taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smell</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 2, 3, § 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:111" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 6, 34, § 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:141" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 141</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sunt ea taedia (sc. muscae et culices) in metallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taedulum: <entryFree id="n47390" type="gloss" key="taedu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taedŭlum</orth> antiqui interdum pro fastidioso; <sense id="n47390.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">interdum, quod omnibus taedio esset, ponere soliti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
taenarus: <entryFree id="n47391" type="main" key="Taena^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Taenărus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tae-nărum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tai/naros</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*tai/naron,</foreign> <sense id="n47391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory and town in Laconia;</hi> <hi rend="ital">on the promontory</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Cape Matapan</hi>) <hi rend="ital">was a temple of Neptune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and near it a cavern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fabled entrance to the infernal regions; it was also famous for its black marble</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 5, 8, § 16</bibl>; Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=181" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 181</bibl> Müll. (Trag. Rel. p. 4 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 662" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 662</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:32 sq" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 4, 467</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">the infernal regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisi horrida Taenari Sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 402" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 402</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47391.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taenărĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tænarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tænarian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also = <hi rend="ital">Laconian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 8, § 28</bibl></cit> (Jahn: <cit><quote lang="la">Taenarum in litus): humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 274: <cit><quote lang="la">columnae,</quote> <trans><tr>of Tænarian marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 49; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taenariae fauces, alta ostia Ditis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the entrance of the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:467" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 467</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vallis,</quote> <trans><tr>the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:612" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 612</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of Pluto</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eurotas,</quote> <trans><tr>Laconian</tr>, <tr>Spartan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Helen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47391.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taenărĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Tænarian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">the Laconian</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Hyacinthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 183</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47391.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Taenăris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tænarian;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Laconian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spartan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:16:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taenia: <entryFree id="n47392" type="greek" key="taeni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taenĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n47392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> taeniis; <cit><quote lang="la">dissyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 269</bibl></cit>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">taini/a,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">a band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ribbon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fillet; a head-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hair-band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bandeau</hi> (syn. vitta). </sense><sense id="n47392.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">taenias Graecam vocem sic interpretatur Verrius, ut dicat ornamentum esse laneum capitis honorati, ut sit apud Caecilium in Androgyno: sepulcrum plenum taeniarum, ita ut solet, et alias: dum taeniam, qui volnus vinciret, petit. Ennius in Alexandro: volans de caelo cum coronā et taeniis (Trag. Rel. v. 33 Rib.): Attius in Neoptolemo: (tumulum) decorare est satius quam urbem taeniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=360" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 360</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. Trag. Rel. v. 472 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">puniceis ibant evincti tempora taeniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:269" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 352</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taenia ne madidos violet bombycina crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:24:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 24, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47392.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things of a like shape. </sense><sense id="n47392.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A tape-worm</hi>: Taenia solium and vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 33, 39, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:102" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 9, 45, § 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 30, 563</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47392.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of fish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ribbon-fish</hi>: Cepola taenia, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 24, § 76</bibl> (Jahn, thynnus).—</sense><sense id="n47392.5" n="C" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">the fillet</hi> which separates the Doric frieze from the architrave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47392.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A streak</hi> in paper, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl> (Sillig).—</sense><sense id="n47392.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A row of projecting rocks</hi> in the sea, <hi rend="ital">a reef</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3</bibl>, prooem. § 4. — Hence the <hi rend="ital">purple-fish</hi> found on these rocks are called taeniense genus purpurarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 131</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taeniensis: <entryFree id="n47393" type="main" key="taeni^ensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taenĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. taenia, II. E.</entryFree>
taeniola: <entryFree id="n47394" type="main" key="taeni^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taenĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>taenia</etym>, <sense id="n47394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little band</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ribbon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taesum: <entryFree id="n47395" type="main" key="taesum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taesum</orth> <itype>est</itype>, v. taedet.</entryFree>
taeter: <entryFree id="n47396" type="main" key="taeter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taeter</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">tēter</orth>), <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. from taedet</etym>. <sense id="n47396.0" n="I" level="1"> Physically, <hi rend="ital">offensive</hi>,<cb n="TAGO" />  <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shocking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loathsome</hi> (class.; syn.: foedus, putidus). </sense><sense id="n47396.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetra et immanis belua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:20:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 20, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor ex multitudine cadaverum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadavera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 415</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut foedā specie taetri turpesque videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">absinthia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:936" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 936</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ulcera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:995" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 995</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1126" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:172" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 172</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 976: cruor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 618</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca taetra, inculta, foeda atque formidolosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">taetris tenebris et caligine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Agr 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter, o dii boni, quam taeter mcedebat, quam truculentus, quam terribilis aspectu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus naturā horridus ac taeter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:191" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tam taetram, tam horribilem tamque infestam rei publicae pestem toties jam effugimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliis aliud retro quoque taetrius esset Naribus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 510</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: taeterrima hiems, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47396.2" n="B" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedā specie taetri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 421</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier taeterrima vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:418" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 418</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">taetrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">offensiveness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae profluentia necessario taetri essent aliquid habitura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47396.3" n="II" level="1"> Mentally or morally. </sense><sense id="n47396.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n47396.5" n="1" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">horrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repulsive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgraceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abominable</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">immanis, turpis): taeter et ferus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ais tu, hominum omnium taeterrume?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam es omni diritate atque immanitate taeterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis taetrior hostis huic civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in eum fuerat taeterrimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47396.6" n="2" level="3"> Of things: postquam discordia taetra Belli ferratos postes portasque refregit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 7, 622</bibl> (Ann. v. 270 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">libido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (sc. cupiditatibus) nihil taetrius nec foedius excogitari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:8:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum vitium taetrius est, quam avaritia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 77</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taeterrimum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47396.7" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> as <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">horridly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horribly</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">taetrum flagrat ... Horror conscius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">taetrē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shockingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideously</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taetricitas: <entryFree id="n47397" type="main" key="taetri^ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taetrĭcĭtas</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tētr-</orth>), <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>taetricus</etym>, <sense id="n47397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serious expression; gravity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seriousness</hi>: habitus oris taetricitate decorus, Auct. Pan. ad Pis. 90.</sense></entryFree>
taetricus: <entryFree id="n47398" type="main" key="taetri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taetrĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tētr-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>taeter</etym>, <sense id="n47398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">forbidding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harsh</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crabbed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristis, severus): puella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 721</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetricus et asper censor udorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 70, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Fates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:73:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 73, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:96:4" default="NO">7, 96, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taetrica ac tristis disciplina Sabinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus (ccupled with horridus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 36:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">febres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:70:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 70, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <trans><tr>fierce</tr>, <tr>warlike</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:80:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 80, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taetritudo: <entryFree id="n47399" type="main" key="taetri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taetrĭtūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tētr-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>teter, I.</etym>, <sense id="n47399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loathsomeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hideousness</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 179, 33</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 556 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
taetro: <entryFree id="n47400" type="main" key="taetro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">taetro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tētr-</orth>) (<sense id="n47400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> perh. not found), <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to render foul</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 7</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 303 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
tagaste: <entryFree id="n47401" type="main" key="Tagaste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tagastē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Numidia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">south-east of</hi> Hippo Regius, the birthplace of St. Augustine, now the ruins of Tagilt, Itin. Anton. p. 44, 6.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tagasten-sis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tagaste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">municeps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tagax: <entryFree id="n47402" type="main" key="ta^gax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăgax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tago</etym>, <sense id="n47402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that is apt to touch</hi> any thing; pregn., <hi rend="ital">light - fingered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thievish</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tagax furunculus a tangendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 408, 33</bibl>: manus, Lucil. ap. Fest. l. l. (Sat. Fragm. 30; 86): levis, libidinosus, tagax, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tages: <entryFree id="n47403" type="main" key="Ta^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăges</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Etrurian divinity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grandson of Jupiter; he sprang from the ploughed earth in the form of a boy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and taught the Etrurians the art of divination</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 23, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:558" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 558</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:345" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 345</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 398</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 4</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăgētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tages</hi>: sacra, Carmin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tago: <entryFree id="n47404" type="main" key="ta^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tăgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. tango <sense id="n47404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi> <pb n="1835" /> <cb n="TALE" /></sense></entryFree>
tagrus: <entryFree id="n47405" type="main" key="Tagrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tagrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tagus: <entryFree id="n47406" type="main" key="Ta^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tăgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Lusitania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its golden sands</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tajo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Tagus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 22, 35, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 251</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 755</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:155" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:559" default="NO">16, 559</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:3" default="NO">10, 96, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talabarrio: <entryFree id="n47407" type="main" key="talabarri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">talabarrĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">talabarrĭ-unculus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <lbl>dim.</lbl>, collat. form used by Laberius; <sense id="n47407.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">words of unknown meaning,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
talaionides: <entryFree id="n47408" type="main" key="Ta^la^i_o^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tălăīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Talaus.</entryFree>
talaria: <entryFree id="n47409" type="main" key="ta_la_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, v. talaris, I. B.</entryFree>
talaris: <entryFree id="n47410" type="main" key="ta_la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>talus</etym>. <sense id="n47410.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the ankles.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47410.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>reaching to the ankles</tr>, <tr>long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13:section=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13, § 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 33, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:37:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 37, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47410.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tā-lārĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> * </sense><sense id="n47410.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The ankles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">parts about the ankles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 53:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 53, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47410.4" n="2" level="3"> (Sc. calceamenta.) <hi rend="ital">Winged shoes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sandals fastened to the ankles.</hi>—Of Mercury, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:736" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 736</bibl>.—Of Perseus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:667" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 667</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 730</bibl>.—Of the fifth Minerva: <cit><quote lang="la">cui pinnarum talaria adfigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">talaria videamus,</quote> <trans><tr>let us think of flight</tr>, <tr>let us fly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47410.5" n="3" level="3"> (Sc. vestimenta.) <hi rend="ital">A long garment reaching down to the ankles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 591</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47410.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dice</hi> (in this sense talarius is more usual, v. h. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludorum talarium licentia,</quote> <trans><tr>of dicing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
talarius: <entryFree id="n47411" type="main" key="ta_la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>talus, II.</etym>, <sense id="n47411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to dice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:42:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 42, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consessus in ludo talario,</quote> <trans><tr>a gaming-house for dice-playing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <trans><tr>relating to dice-playing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 9</bibl></cit> (dub.; Ritschl, alearia).</sense></entryFree>
talasio: <entryFree id="n47412" type="main" key="Ta^lasi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tălasĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Tălassĭo</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tă-lassĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Thăl-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a congratulatory exclamation to a bride</hi>, in use from the time of Romulus, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*(umh\n w)= n(me/naie.</foreign> Its meaning was unknown to the ancient writers themselves, but it was probably the name of the god of marriage, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 651</bibl>; Fest. pp. 351 and 350 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:36:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 36, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:42:4" default="NO">12, 42, 4</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 17 (2d ed.).— In mal. part.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:96:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 96, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
talaus: <entryFree id="n47413" type="main" key="Ta^la^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tălăus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*talao/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Argonaut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Adrastus and Eriphyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:356" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 356</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tălăīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one sprung from Talaus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the offspring of Talaus</hi>, of <hi rend="ital">Adrastus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:18" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 140</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Eriphyle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talea: <entryFree id="n47414" type="main" key="ta_le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slender staff</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rod</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bar</hi> (syn.: virga, stipes). </sense><sense id="n47414.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">taleae pedem longae ferreis hamis infixis totae in terram infodiebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: ferreae, <hi rend="ital">iron rods</hi>, used as money by the Britons, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 6, 8, § 23</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47414.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47414.3" n="A" level="2"> In agricult., </sense><sense id="n47414.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A cutting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">layer</hi> for planting, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:40:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 40, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:31:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:4" default="NO">4, 33, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 61</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47414.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a scion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twig</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sprig</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 12, 167</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47414.6" n="B" level="2"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a small beam used for binding together the joints of a wall</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talentarius: <entryFree id="n47415" type="hapax" key="ta^lenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tălentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>talentum</etym>, <sense id="n47415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a talent</hi> (in weight): balistae, <hi rend="ital">throwing stones of a talent in weight</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talentum: <entryFree id="n47416" type="main" key="ta^lentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tălentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n47416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> talentum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 16, 12</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely talentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ta/lanton,</foreign> a thing weighed, a weight; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a talent</hi>, i. e., </sense><sense id="n47416.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian weight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varying in different states</hi>, <hi rend="ital">usually about half a hundred-weight</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">auri eborisque talenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thynni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 17, 40, § 80</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47416.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sum of money</hi>, <hi rend="ital">likewise varying in amount.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47416.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Attic talent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which is most usually meant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contained sixty minæ</hi>, i. e. £243 15<hi rend="ital">s.</hi> sterling ($1182.19 in American gold): <cit><quote lang="la">cum legati ab Alexandro quinquaginta ei talenta attulissent, quae erat pecunia temporibus illis, Athenis praesertim, maxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem milia talantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 8, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 60</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 226</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7, 89 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 37 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl>.—Sometimes called also magnum, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:10:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1</bibl>, <cb n="TALI" /> 110; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47416.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Another talent of eighty minæ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47416.5" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The Egyptian talent</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 15, § 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taleola: <entryFree id="n47417" type="main" key="ta_le^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĕŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>talea</etym>, <sense id="n47417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small slip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">set</hi> for planting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:17:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 17, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:33:1" default="NO">12, 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:48:2" default="NO">12, 48, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talge: <entryFree id="n47418" type="main" key="Talge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Talgē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Caspian Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:10" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
talio: <entryFree id="n47419" type="main" key="ta_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<sense id="n47419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl>) [talis]; in jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a punishment similar and equal to the injury sustained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like for like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retaliation in kind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talionis mentionem fieri in XII. ait Verrius hoc modo: si membrum rupit, ni cum eo pacit, talio esto, neque id, quid significet, indicat, puto, quia notum est. Permittit enim lex parem vindictam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=363" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 363</bibl></cit> Müll.; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 710</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:33 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 33 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:38" default="NO">20, 1, 38</bibl>; Cic. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 54, 55, § 187</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpit sine talione caelebs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with impunity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:63:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 63, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
talipedo: <entryFree id="n47420" type="gloss" key="ta_li^pe^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭpĕdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (prop. to walk on the ankles), <sense id="n47420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be weak in the feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to totter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talipedare antiqui dicebant pro vacillare pedibus lassitudine, quasi qui trahit pedes, ut talis videatur insistere aut identidem tollere pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=359" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 359</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
talis: <entryFree id="n47421" type="main" key="ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>demonstr. stem to-, cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">thli/kos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n47421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of such a kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such like;</hi> with a corresp. <hi rend="ital">qualis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47421.1" n="I" level="1"> Ingen. </sense><sense id="n47421.2" n="A" level="2"> With correlatives. </sense><sense id="n47421.3" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">qualis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talis est quaeque res publica, qualis ejus aut natura aut voluntas, qui illam regit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut facillime, quales simus, tales esse videamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset talis, qualem te esse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale solet viscum virere ... Talis erat species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 208</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:31:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 31, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.4" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faxo tali eum mactatum, atque hic est, infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 39: <cit><quote lang="la">honos tali populi Romani voluntate paucis est delatus ac mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tales nos esse putamus, ut jure laudemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc rationem videtis esse talem, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia esse scio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.6" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">talem te esse oportet, qui primum te ab impiorum civium societate sejungas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultima talis erit, quae mea prima fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:170" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 170</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> </sense><sense id="n47421.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the like</hi>: sin est probus (Cresphontes maritus meus), Cur talem invitam invitum cogis linquere? Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 24, 38</bibl> (Trag. v. 158 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quoi in re tali jam subvenisti antidhac,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid tale putavi fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum abest, ut et ipsi tale quicquam facturi fueritis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a quo tale quid dictum referretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod erit ejusmodi, nihil ut tale ullā in re publicā reperiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:23:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 23, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem legem esse laudabilem, quibusdam talibus argumentis docent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec taliaque vociferantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil metuens tale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:67" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp., in discourse, etc., referring to something that follows, <hi rend="ital">the following</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as follows</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such as this</hi>, etc.: talia commemorat lacrimans, exterrita somno: Eurydica, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 37 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">talia fatur: Salve, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 559</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 372</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia tum placido Saturnius edidit ore: dicite, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 703</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tale est: occidisti hominem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:41" default="NO">9, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 298</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali modo liberatus est,</quote> <trans><tr>as follows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47421.10" n="II" level="1"> In partic., pregn., like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">toio/sde</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">toiou=tos,</foreign> <hi rend="ital">of such an especial kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi> (both in a good and a bad sense), <hi rend="ital">so distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">so great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extreme</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bad</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">such</hi> emphatically, = tantus: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu, talis vir, falsum autumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos corrumpis talis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talem, tali genere atque animo natum ex tantā familiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam times, ne illum talem praeripiat tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus tantis, talibus gestis, quid fuit causae, cur, etc.?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tuā sponte faceres in hominem tantum et talem, calamitosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 66, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes tantas atque tales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 92</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid negotii geritur, in quo ille tot et tales viros defatigat?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 13, 42</bibl></cit>: judices tali dignitate praediti, id. Clu. <cb n="TAM" /> 53, 147; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tali facinore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamen is ad id locorum talis vir consulatum petere non audebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 63, 6</bibl></cit>: tali tempore, <hi rend="ital">at so critical a time</hi>, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl>, A, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 35, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37:8" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 37, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:303 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 303 al.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in such wise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in such sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">qualiter ... taliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:7:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 11, 40, § 124</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
taliscumque: <entryFree id="n47422" type="hapax" key="ta_liscumque"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālis-cumque</orth>, <itype>talecumque</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n47422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of about such a nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale fuit malum . . . taliacumque, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
taliter: <entryFree id="n47423" type="main" key="ta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. talis <sense id="n47423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
talitrum: <entryFree id="n47424" type="hapax" key="ta_litrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tālitrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. from talus</etym>, <sense id="n47424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fillip with the finger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput talitro vulnerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 68 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
