P. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec formā tangor, poteram tamen hac quoque tangi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 614</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota tamen tetigere deos, tetigere parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nymphas tetigit nova res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:552" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 552</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec amor nos tangit habendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 541</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplo tangi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 15</bibl></cit> (16), 326; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:489" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 489</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:9:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">religione tactus hospes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetigerat animum memoria nepotum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem gloria tangit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47460.17" n="B" level="2"> Qs. to prick or stick one, i. e., </sense><sense id="n47460.18" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dupe; to cozen</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cheat out of</hi> any thing (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">tuom tangam patrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">probe tactus Ballio est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tangere hominem volt bolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istis adeo te tetigi triginta minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: senem triginta minis, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 257</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenunculum aere militari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: patrem talento argenti, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 408, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus sum vehementer visco,</quote> <trans><tr>I am limed</tr>, <tr>caught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres harundinibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47460.19" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To sting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nettle</hi> any one by something said: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto Rhodium tetigerim in convivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl></cit> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n47460.20" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to touch upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speak of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refer to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tango, quod avarus homo est, quodque improbu' mitto, Lucil. ap. Rufin. Schem. Lex. § 12 (p. 274 Frotsch.): leviter unum quodque tangam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:30:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 30, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi Aristoteles ista tetigit?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud tertium, quod a Crasso tactum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:10:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 10, 43</bibl></cit>: ne tangantur rationes ad Opis, <hi rend="ital">be discussed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">examined</hi>, Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 9, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tacta loquar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid minus utibile fuit quam hoc ulcus tangere Aut nominare uxorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47460.21" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take in hand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undertake</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:12:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 12, 17</bibl></cit>: quis te Carminis heroi tangere jussit opus? prop. 4, 2 (3, 3), 16.</sense></entryFree>
taniacae: <entryFree id="n47461" type="main" key="tani^a^cae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tanĭăcae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">long strips of pork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanos: <entryFree id="n47462" type="main" key="tanos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tanos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tanquam: <entryFree id="n47463" type="main" key="tanquam"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tanquam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tamquam.</entryFree>
tantaleus: <entryFree id="n47464" type="main" key="Tanta^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tantălĕus, Tantălĭdes, Tantă-lis</orth>, v. Tantalus.</entryFree>
tantalus: <entryFree id="n47465" type="main" key="Tanta^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tantălus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-los</orth>), <itype>i</itype> (Greek collat. form of <case>dat.</case> Tantaleo, after the form <foreign lang="greek">*tantaleu/s</foreign>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ta/ntalos,</foreign> <sense id="n47465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Jupiter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Pelops and Niobe.</hi> He was admitted by Jupiter to the feasts of the gods; <cit><quote lang="la">but, having disclosed their secrets, he was sent for punishment to the infernal regions, where he stood up to his chin in water under an overhanging fruittree, both of which retreated whenever he attempted to satisfy the hunger and thirst that tormented him. A rock also hung over him ever threatening to fall,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 82" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 457</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 172</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 41</bibl>; Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:16:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 16, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 60</bibl>; Hor. Epod. <cb n="TANT" /> 17, 66; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:77 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 77 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n47465.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tantălĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tantalus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit> (3, 9), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:128" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 128</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47465.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tantălĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Tantalus;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Pelops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:385" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 385</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">the grandsons of Tantalus</hi> (<hi rend="ital">Atreus and Thyestes</hi>): Tantalidarum internecio, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Tantalidae fratres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:627" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 627</bibl></cit>; of <hi rend="ital">his great-grandson</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Agamemnon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 626</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 8, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 8, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:307 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 307 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n47465.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tan-tălis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a female descendant of Tantalus;</hi> of <hi rend="ital">Niobe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:193" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 197" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 197</bibl>; of <hi rend="ital">Hermione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Menelaus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres,</quote> <trans><tr>descended from Tantalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 66</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tantillus: <entryFree id="n47466" type="main" key="tantillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantillus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tantulus], <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so small;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so little a thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such a little thing</hi> (mostly anteclass.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n47466.1" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">correl.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">febrem tantillam esse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantillum loci, ubi catellus cubet, id mihi sat est loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hercle tantillum peccassis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 106</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47466.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quem ego modo puerum tantillum in manibus gestavi meis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum mulieris! tantilla tanta verba funditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47466.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tan-tillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such a trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoccine mihi ob labores tantos tantillum dari?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud tantillo minus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tantisper: <entryFree id="n47467" type="main" key="tantisper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantis-per</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>tantus</etym>, <sense id="n47467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for so long a time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so long; in the mean time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meanwhile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47467.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dum</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic tantisper, dum exis, te opperiar foris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meretrix tantisper blanditur, dum illud, quod rapiat, videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantisper volo, Dum facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ibi esset tantisper, dum culeus compararetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:50:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 50, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latendum tantisper ibidem, dum defervescat haec gratulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47467.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quoad</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut viveret tantisper, quoad fieret permutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere tantisper, quoad de servitute constet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:18:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 18, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47467.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego hic astabo tantisper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantisper hic ego ad januam concessero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totos dies scribo, non quo proficiam quid, sed tantisper impedior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed videro, quid efficiat: tantisper hoc ipsum magni aestimo, quod pollicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantisper tutelā muliebri res Latina puero stetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 22, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tantopere: <entryFree id="n47468" type="main" key="tanto^pe^re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantŏpĕre</orth>, v. tantus, I.</entryFree>
tantulus: <entryFree id="n47469" type="main" key="tantu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tantus], <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so small;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">neutr. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such a trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever so little</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">a favorite word with Cic.): non tantulum Usquam intermittit tempus, quin eum nominet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omitto vim, quae ex fici tantulo grano ... tantos truncos ramosque procreet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines tantulae staturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantularum rerum occupationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantulo spatio interjecto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantula causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem tantulum malum esse, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 332, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such a trifle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si interesse quippiam tantulum modo potuerit, amicitiae nomen occiderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:12:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 12, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo tantum, sed ne tantulum quidem praeterieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ex eo negotio tantulum in rem suam convertisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:39:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantulum de arte concedere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 40</bibl></cit>. 118: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum oratione iste ne tantulum quidem commotus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde, cur tantulo venierint,</quote> <trans><tr>for such a trifle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tantuli eget, quantum est opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantulum morae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tantum: <entryFree id="n47470" type="main" key="tantum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tantus <sense id="n47470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tantummodo: <entryFree id="n47471" type="main" key="tantummo^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantummŏdo</orth>, v. tantus, II. B. b.</entryFree>
tantundem: <entryFree id="n47472" type="main" key="tantundem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantundem</orth>, v. tantusdem.</entryFree>
tantus: <entryFree id="n47473" type="main" key="tantus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tantus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. for tavantus; cf. Sanscr. tāvant, so great; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">te/ws,</foreign> i. e. <foreign lang="greek">tevws</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n47473.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of such size</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so great</hi> in amount, extent, value, degree, etc. (as some standard expressed or understood); usually with a foll. <hi rend="ital">quantus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">qui</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.;</hi> rarely <hi rend="ital">quam.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47473.1" n="1" level="3"> With <pb n="1841" /> <cb n="TANT" /> <hi rend="ital">quantus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam (contionem) umquam vidi tantam, quanta nunc vestrum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tanta sunt in hoc uno, quanta in omnibus reliquis imperatoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est alienum tanto viro, quantus es tu, non posse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam eorum multitudinem nostri interfecerunt, quantum fuit diei spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam Demaden continua dicendi exercitatio potuerit tantum, quantuluscumque postea fuit, fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47473.3" n="a" level="4"> Denoting result or consequence; with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta erat operis firmitudo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> B G 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non fuit tantus homo Sex. Roscius in civitate, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:43:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 43, 125</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc definio, tantam esse necessitatem virtutis ... ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego tantum nefas commisi, ut hanc vicem saevitiae meae redderes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tantum cogitavi nefas, ut dignior Philotas me videretur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 7, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.4" n="b" level="4"> Denoting comparison: <cit><quote lang="la">tantā modestiā dicto audiens fuit, ut si privatus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47473.5" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">rel. qui</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cave putes aut mare ullum aut flammam esse tantam, quam non facilius sit sedare quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerunt, tantum illud esse maleficium, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla est tanta vis, quae non ferro frangi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,032:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marcell. 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.6" n="4" level="3"> Without correlation (esp. freq. in exclamations, etc.) ita tanta mira in aedibus sunt facta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta factis modo mira miris modis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tantus natu deorum nescis nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum in tantis rebus, sed etiam in mediocribus vel studiis vel officiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantilla tanta verba funditat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 61</bibl></cit>. hocine mihi ob labores tantos tantillum dari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tantae nationes conjugantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit> in tantis motionibus tantisque vicissitudinibus, tam multarum rerum atque tantarum ordinious, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 2, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non idem sentio tanta hac in re tamque immensa posse fieri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or 2, 20, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tantas et tam infinitas pecunias repudiarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tantaque vitia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr 1, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae faceres in hominem tantum et talem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:66:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 66, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">conservare urbes tantas atque tales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 92</bibl></cit>, so too, with talis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta ista mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 40, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Liv 31, 9: neque tanto tractu se colligit anguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantorum ingentia septem Terga boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 404</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:28" default="NO">3, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:1" default="NO">4, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexcenta tanta reddam, si vivo, tibi,</quote> <trans><tr>six hundred times as much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 111</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sexcenta tanta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribus tantis illi minus redit quam obseveris,</quote> <trans><tr>three times as much less</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam non quaero, unde tantam Melitensem vestem habueris,</quote> <trans><tr>such a great quantity of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in uno corpore tantarum rerum gubernationem mens humana possidet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.7" n="5" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maria aspera juro, Non ullum pro me tantum cepisse timorem, Quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 352</bibl></cit> (cf. infra, B. 2.).—With a <hi rend="ital">partit. gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus ille ventorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl></cit> (dub.; Jahn, ventus).—</sense><sense id="n47473.8" n="6" level="3"> Esp. in phrase <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantō ŏpĕre</orth>; freq. as one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantŏpĕre</orth>, <hi rend="ital">so greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in so high a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so very</hi>, etc. (class. and freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">cur tanto opere extimueras?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 92</bibl></cit>, cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si studia Graecorum vos tanto opere delectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:18:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 18, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:164 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 164 al.</bibl>—In an inverted order: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum est, me, ut redeam, te opere tanto quaesere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">so many</hi> ( = tot; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">tantae Coëunt in proelia gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:636" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentabile tantis urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:160" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatum valet in tantos quanti inveniantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:65" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 65</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam tanto se vulture caelum Induit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:834" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 834</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47473.10" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr. absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47473.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so many</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere tantum molestiae quantum gloriae...ut tantum nobis, quantum ipsi superesse posset, remitteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decutio argenti tantum, quantum mihi lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis adposuit tantum, quod satis esset, nullo adparatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:32:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 32, 91</bibl></cit>: tantum complectitur, <cb n="TANT" /> quod satis sit modicae palaestrae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo indito cumini fricti tantum, quod oleat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 3</bibl></cit> (cf.: tantum quod, s. v. <itype>tantum</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos> B. 2. b.): <hi rend="ital">Ch.</hi> Coactus reddidit ducentos et mille Philippum. <hi rend="ital">Ni.</hi> Tantum debuit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 38</bibl>: nec tantum Karthago habuisset opum, Cic. Rep. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 526</bibl> (1, 48, 3 B. and K.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tantum belli in manibus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed quid hic tantum hominum incedunt?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum hostium intra muros est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sexies tantum, quam quantum satum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:43:section=102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 43, § 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi alterum tantum perdundum est, perdam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 81</bibl></cit> (v. alter): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum ... dum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum modo ... dum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53, 3</bibl></cit>: tantum abest, ut, etc. (v. absum). —</sense><sense id="n47473.12" n="b" level="4"> In colloquial lang.: tantum est, <hi rend="ital">that is all</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing more</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos rogat, ut, etc. Tantum est. Valete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 22</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. prol. 87</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Lo.</hi> Numquid amplius? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Tantum est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> (of price) <orth extent="full" lang="la">tanti</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti, quanti poscit, vin' tanti illam emi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti est, quanti est fungus putidus,</quote> <trans><tr>it is worth as much as</tr>, <tr>is worth no more than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum tanti fuit, quanti iste aestimavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:84:section=194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 84, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi me dixero dare tanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter increpuit, tanti habitare censorem,</quote> <trans><tr>in so costly a house</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47473.14" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: est tanti (alicui), <hi rend="ital">to be worth so much; to be valued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prized</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">esteemed so highly; to be of such consequence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">importance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti ejus apud se gratiam esse ostendit, uti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: tanti non fuit Arsacen capere, ut, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc tanti fuit vertere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: est mihi tanti, Quirites, hujus invidiae tempestatem subire, dummodo a vobis hujus belli periculum depellatur, <hi rend="ital">it is worth this price to me</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I esteem it a light thing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sed est tanti (sc.: invidiam istam mihi impendere), dummodo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi id quidem non tanti est, quam quod propter eosdem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:22:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juratus tibi possum dicere, nihil esse tanti, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dicturis tanti suae non sint (actiones),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt o! sunt jurgia tanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:424" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 424</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n47473.15" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> (with comparatives) <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantō</orth>, <hi rend="ital">by so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much the</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto erat in dies gravior oppugnatio, tanto crebriores litterae nuntiique ad Caesarem mittebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum opere processerant, tanto aberant ab aquā longius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto major vis, quanto recentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reperietis quinquies tanto amplius istum quam quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 225</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantone minoris decumae venierunt quam fuerunt?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 45</bibl></cit>, § 106 et saep.: bis tanto amici sunt inter se quam prius, <hi rend="ital">twice as much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice as good</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">di\s to/sw|,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis tanto pluris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ter tanto pejor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo tanto miserior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Cleomenes non tanto ante fugisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:34:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 34, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post tanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 476</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 26</bibl>.— Rarely with <hi rend="ital">verbs denoting comparison</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto praestitit ceteros imperatores, quan to populus Romanus antecedit fortitudine cunctas nationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 368</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrinis tanto antecessit condiscipulos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto pessimus omnium poëta, Quanto tu optimus omnium patronus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 49, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.16" n="b" level="4"> In colloquial lang.: tanto melior! <hi rend="ital">so much the better! well done! good! excellent! bravo!</hi> etc.: <hi rend="ital">To.</hi> Omnes sycophantias instruxi et comparavi, quo pacto ab lenone auferam hoc argentum. <hi rend="ital">Sa.</hi> Tanto melior! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 24</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 31</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so too: tanto melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto hercle melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto major! tanto augustior!</quote> <trans><tr>how great! how noble!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:71:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 71, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto nequior!</quote> <trans><tr>so much the worse! that is bad!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 84</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tanto miserior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.17" n="4" level="3"> In tantum, <hi rend="ital">so far</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so greatly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">danti in tantum producenda notitia est muneris sui, in quantum delectatura est eum, cui datur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:24:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 24, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam aquae fervent in tantum, ut non possint esse usui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:24:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: humum in tantum deprimere,<cb n="TANT" />  donec altitudinis mensuram datam ceperit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantum suam felicitatem virtutemque enituisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47473.18" n="II" level="1"> Since tantus conveys only the idea of relative greatness, it may also be used (with a foll. <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>) to denote a small amount, degree, extent, etc.; hence, <hi rend="ital">of such a quantity</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">such</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so slight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trivial;</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so few</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ceterarum provinciarum vectigalia tanta sunt, ut iis ad ipsas provincias tutandas vix contenti esse possimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl>: si bellum tantum erit, ut vos aut successores sustinere possint, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidii tantum est, ut ne murus quidem cingi possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n47473.19" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">So much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so greatly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to such a degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum, quantum quis fuge,</quote> <trans><tr>as quickly as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo tantum, quantum me amas, velim cogites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id tantum abest ab officio, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>so far</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex tantum auctoritate ejus motus est, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum progressus a castris, ut dimicaturum appareret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumque ibi moratus, dum, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>so long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 42, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum ad narrandum argumentum adest benignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne miremini, quā ratione hic tantum apud istum libertus potuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:54:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 54, § 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo tantum se Mysia cultu Jactat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 102</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum dulcia, quantum Et liquida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus Non tantum Veneris quantum studiosa culinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum dissimilis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marius quantum bello optimus, tantum pace pessimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.20" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to tantus, II.; and therefore, prop., only so much, so little; hence) <hi rend="ital">Only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum monet, quantum intellegit,</quote> <trans><tr>only so much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum in latitudinem patebat, quantum loci acies instructa occupare poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod haec tantum, quantum sensu movetur...se accommodat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem tantum de vitā et de moribus solitum esse quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tantum virtutis usurpas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixit tantum: nihil ostendit, nihil protulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notus mihi nomine tantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apte dicere non elocutionis tantum genere constat, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non tantum ... sed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tantum ... sed (etiam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 8, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:78" default="NO">9, 3, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:5" default="NO">11, 2, 5</bibl>.—So with unus (mostly post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">once in Cic.): excepit unum tantum: scire se nihil se scire, nihil amplius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum flumen tantum intererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum defuisse tantum superbiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:50:6" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 50, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.21" n="b" level="4"> Strengthened by modo, and also joined with it in one word, <orth extent="full" lang="la">tantummŏdo</orth> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas solummodo is only post-Aug., v. h. v.): homines populariter annum tantummodo solis, id est unius astri reditu metiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:22:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 22, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tantummodo per stirpes alantur suas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:32:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 32, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tantummodo potestatem gustandi feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis ea judicatio versatur tantummodo in nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedites tantummodo umeris ac summo pectore exstare (ut possent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velis tantummodo,</quote> <trans><tr>you have only to wish it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum hoc tantummodo, neque praeterea quicquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eum oratorem tantummodo, sed hominem non putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque e silvis tantummodo promota castra, sed etiam ... in campos delata acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cn. Scipionem misit non ad tuendos tantummodo veteres socios, sed etiam ad pellendum Hispaniā Hasdrubalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">non tantummodo ... sed etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Polyb. 15:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Polyb. 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ot. Sap. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:4" default="NO">5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Verr. p. 124" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Verr. p. 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantummodo ... sed ... quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:110:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 110, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tantummodo ... verum etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 162:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 162, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Grat. Christ. 14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Grat. Christ. 14</bibl>: non ... tantum, with ellips. of <hi rend="ital">sed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not only</hi> (but much more), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 63</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem atrocem nec tantum epistulā dignam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.22" n="2" level="3"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n47473.23" n="a" level="4"> Tantum non, analog. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mo/non ou)k,</foreign> to <pb n="1842" /> <cb n="TANT" /> point out an action as <hi rend="ital">only not</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">very nearly</hi>, completed, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all but</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very nearly</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 5, 2</bibl>, Baiter reads tantummodo): <cit><quote lang="la">cum agger promotus ad urbem vineaeque tantum non jam injunctae moenibus essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non jam captam Lacedaemonem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non ad portam bellum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videt Romanos tantum non jam circumveniri a dextro cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum hostes tantum non arcessierint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non adversis tempestatibus Rhodum enavigavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non statim a funere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non summam malorum suorum professus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non in ipso ejus consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit> et saep.—But in many cases non belongs to the verb, and not to tantum: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum non cunctandum neque cessandum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>only there must be no delay</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator bello ita gesto, ut tantum non defuisse fortunae videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:57:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 57, 8</bibl></cit> Drak.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui per haec vicit, tantum non defuisse sibi advocatum sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47473.24" n="b" level="4"> Tantum quod, denoting immediate nearness in point of time, <hi rend="ital">only</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but just</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just then</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hardly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcely</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quod ex Arpinati veneram, cum mihi a te litterae redditae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quod ultimam imposuerat Pannonico bello Caesar manum, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 117, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum scriberem, tantum quod existimabam ad te orationem esse perlatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis Alexandrina, quae tantum quod appulerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natus est XVIII. Cal. Jan. tantum quod oriente sole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quod pueritiam egresso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentem tantum quod exemptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 5, 4</bibl>, the quod belongs not to tantum, but to the following verb): <cit><quote lang="la">tantum alone = tantum quod,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47473.25" n="c" level="4"> Tantum quod non, <hi rend="ital">only that not</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nothing is wanting but</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum quod hominem non nominat: causam quidem totam perscribit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:45:section=116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 45, § 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
